comments:
There's a subtle bug in the config.ini of the new RC2:

The line
eclipse.product=org.eclipse.sdk.ide

must be replaced with
eclipse.product=org.eclipse.platform.ide

because the product-ID changed.

Else Eclipse will refuse to start and give you this error:
"No application id has been found."

Nope.  There is a new SDK product.  The id is correct.  RC2 seems to be 
startig fine for everyone around here.

Strange. I downloaded from the Austrian mirror under
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/downloads/drops/S-3.1RC2-200506101757/eclipse-SDK-3.1RC2-win32.zip&url=http://gd.tuwien.ac.at/softeng/eclipse/S-3.1RC2-200506101757/eclipse-SDK-3.1RC2-win32.zip&mirror_id=7

and in the ZIP the config.ini is definitely wrong. Just checked again.
In the config.ini therein it reads:

eclipse.product=org.eclipse.sdk.ide

Strange that only one mirrored ZIP should be wrong, but it is.

When Jeff said the product id was correct he meant that org.eclipse.sdk.ide *is*
the *right* default product for RC2. The SDK drop contains such product. The
main difference you can notice is that instead of opening the Resource
perspective on a new workspace and showing a Welcome view, it now opens on the
Java perspective (which is what most people downloading the SDk want).

That being said, it should not be causing any startup problems to you. How did
you install Eclipse RC2? On an empty directory or on top of an existing install?

Thanks for the explanation.
However I'm still experiencing the problem, also with RC3.

I have been working with Eclipse since 1.0 (ok actively since 2.0:), so I have a
Java workspace with some plugins set up.

I always install into a new directory, so it's really a fresh installation.
I only take my old configuration with me, but always overwrite config.ini (the
only file contained in the corresponding directory in the ZIP).

This is the error-message I get btw:

!SESSION 2005-06-22 11:09:47.192 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20050617-1618
java.version=1.5.0_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_AT
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2005-06-22 11:09:53.99
!MESSAGE Product org.eclipse.sdk.ide could not be found.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-06-22 11:09:53.177
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.RuntimeException: No application id has been found.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:204)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:376)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

you are likely taking too much of the old configuration.  There are no 
guarantees about the format or content of the configuration area.  The files 
there are the private domain of the related plugins and they are free to do 
what they like.  Please retry with a fresh config area.

I will try, thanks.
However I do not understand why the readme.html explicitly states that the
product id should be changed to the new one, in the section

"No branding with old config.ini":

"The work around is either to delete the local config.ini or update the
eclipse.product line to read eclipse.product=org.eclipse.platform.ide."

With this change, it works perfectly, so I'm still puzzled.
We have not been able to reproduce. Closing.

traces.message: No application id has been found.
